Sentencas: Operating solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks with ammonia induces the risk of nitriding in the fuel electrode and other metallic surfaces in the stack.
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia

Sentencas: This study aims to investigate the nitriding in the fuel electrode of an ammonia-fueled SOFC stack using a 3D Multi -physics model of a full stack.
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia

Sentencas: Based on the resulting species concentrations, a so-called nitriding potential is determined and compared to its critical level for various operating conditions and design modifications.
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia

Sentencas: The effects of the gas inflow temperatures, counter -flow configuration, and nickel coating over the inlet header of the stack are investigated.
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia

Sentencas: The results show that nitriding occurs in the first few centimeters of the fuel electrode for all investigated operating conditions considered in this study.
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia

Sentencas: Moreover, it is indicated that higher gas inflow temperatures and counter-flow configuration reduce the nitriding in the fuel electrode.
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia

Sentencas: Furthermore, the model illustrates the nitriding in the fuel active electrode for the gas inflow temperatures up to 700 degrees C. Finally, a significant reduction in nitriding in the fuel electrode is shown for a proposed nickel coating over the metallic inlet header due to a spreading of the ammonia decomposition.(c) 2023
Titulo: A numerical investigation of nitridation in solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with ammonia
